text:

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: You may, sir. ’Tis a point of wisdom.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Fare you well.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: What, shall I stab him as he

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: sleeps?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: No. He’ll say ’twas done cowardly,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: when he wakes.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Why, he shall never wake until the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: great Judgment Day.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Why, then he’ll say we stabbed him

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: sleeping.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: The urging of that word “judgment”

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: hath bred a kind of remorse in me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: What, art thou afraid?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Not to kill him, having a warrant,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: but to be damned for killing him, from the which

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: no warrant can defend me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: I thought thou hadst been resolute.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: So I am—to let him live.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: I’ll back to the Duke of Gloucester

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: and tell him so.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Nay, I prithee stay a little. I hope

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: this passionate humor of mine will change. It was

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: wont to hold me but while one tells twenty.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: How dost thou feel thyself now?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Faith, some certain dregs of conscience

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: are yet within me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Remember our reward when the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: deed’s done.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Zounds, he dies! I had forgot the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: reward.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Where’s thy conscience now?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: O, in the Duke of Gloucester’s

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: purse.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: When he opens his purse to give us

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: our reward, thy conscience flies out.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: ’Tis no matter. Let it go. There’s

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: few or none will entertain it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: What if it come to thee again?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: I’ll not meddle with it. It makes a

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: man a coward: a man cannot steal but it accuseth

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: him; a man cannot swear but it checks him; a man

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: cannot lie with his neighbor’s wife but it detects

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: him. ’Tis a blushing, shamefaced spirit that mutinies

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: in a man’s bosom. It fills a man full of

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: obstacles. It made me once restore a purse of gold

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: that by chance I found. It beggars any man that

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: keeps it. It is turned out of towns and cities for a

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: dangerous thing, and every man that means to live

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: well endeavors to trust to himself and live without it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Zounds, ’tis even now at my elbow,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: persuading me not to kill the Duke.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Take the devil in thy mind, and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: believe him not. He would insinuate with thee but

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: to make thee sigh.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: I am strong-framed. He cannot prevail

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: with me.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: Spoke like a tall man that respects

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: thy reputation. Come, shall we fall to work?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Take him on the costard with the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: hilts of thy sword, and then throw him into the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: malmsey butt in the next room.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: O, excellent device—and make a

speaker:
SECOND
               
              MURDERER
text: sop of him!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: Soft, he wakes.

speaker:
SECOND

text: Strike!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              MURDERER
text: No, we’ll reason with him.

speaker: CLARENCE
text:
Where
               
              art
               
              thou
              ,
               
              keeper
              ?
